alert.note: Alert for Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 22 at 8:50PM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Iowa...Wisconsin... Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10 affecting Grant and Clayton Counties. .The Mississippi River will likely reach major flood stage next weekend. Due to this, a new Flood Warning was issued for this location. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM CDT Saturday was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 21.1 feet next Saturday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.7 feet on 04/21/2001. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 845 AM CDT.
